subject: Mental Health
title: Flashbacks and Triggers
description: Learn Flashbacks and Triggers in one minute.

hook.text: A certain perfume. A car horn. Suddenly you're back in the worst moment of your life.

buildup.text: Flashbacks aren't memories â€” they're the brain reliving the trauma as if it's now.

discovery.text: Triggers are sensory cues linked to the original event stored by the amygdala.

twist.text: The trigger can be so subtle the person doesn't consciously recognize it.

climax.text: During a flashback, the body reacts with full survival physiology.

punchline.text: The past breaks into the present uninvited.

quiz.question: Why do flashbacks feel like reliving the event?
options: The brain processes them as happening now, not as memories
